website_summaries.verdict: Neatly does it all, from removing rust to creating art all with a single, tried and true unit.
pros: Reviewers suggest this product should be owned by any professional for maintenance
Brings old antiques back to life and etches glass like the best of them
We love the tutorials this product arrives with
cons: Great for small projects but doesn't have the capacity to scale

customer_reviews.title: Powerful unit!
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the photos we are restoring a farm all tractor and this sand blaster is such a big help!!! It would have been nice to have a bigger hopper but that is truly the only thing we would change! It never clogged and did a good job removing the 50+year old baked on paint.
customer_reviews.author: Ranchwife

customer_reviews.title: Purchase blasting media.
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty well, but definitely took some time to get down the technique. I used play sand, but discovered that the occasional clumped grains caused plugging of the system. I ended up getting a sifter from the kitchen and double sifting the sand. If commercially prepared material had been readily available, I'd have interrupted the project and picked some up. I'd suggest purchasing some prepared sandblasting media.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It runs through sand fast . But it cuts through sand and paint like butter.
customer_reviews.author: David payne

customer_reviews.title: This is a very lightweight plastic unit that wont last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for stripping paint off small engine parts, The unit is flimsy, even the trigger is plastic. Tried various substrates with varied results, a very slow and painful process. You need a space suite and welding gloves, the bounce back on a short nozzle is vicious, you get substrate in every orifice known to man. So what is it useful for? Paint strip everything first, wipe/ wire brush off the majority of the paint and use this thingie as a final polishing tool.....period.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Uses many different mediums
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This is little but packs a punch. Not to heavy even when sand is being used. Redoing a desk and it had alot of detailed work and it has had NO problem getting in all the nooks and crannies. Lets off the normall amount of dust and is easily cleaned up. Lightweight design helps to make it easy to hold in different positions. Long pull trigger makes it easy to use one or many fingers to pull it. Ohh it came with an pour screen to help with over filling. Happy with my purchase will update when i am able to add pictures.
customer_reviews.author: D.Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: This could be one of the best tools I own. I bought the Speed Blaster to replace a large sand blasting unit that my 60gallon, 125 PSI, 5 HP compressor did not have enough air capacity to operate. This SandBlaster, using Black Beauty grit, did a great job of removing rust without exceeding the limits of my air compressor. Highly recommend for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly, my gamble on this sandblaster paid off. Thanks!
customer_reviews.text: I had two tables that I wanted to revive because of an upcoming reunion event that will be held here at home. Due to some bad luck, my old pal sandblaster broke and I was left with no choice but to buy a new one. Saw LE LEMATEC. "Oh, a new gun? There are no reviews." was what I first thought. I decided to order this one because the description interested me. I just would like to say that this didn't disappoint me. My gamble paid off! This particular gun isn't tiring to use and my project ended up being quite enjoyable. Now my tables are ready and are waiting to be used. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Tried using this thing right out of the box with glass beads and this thing creates a huge mess without even removing any material. Bought this to sand blast my engine block before I put it back in the truck and I am extremely disappointed with it. It took off about a quarter size of rust while blowing the whole container of glass beads everywhere else..
customer_reviews.author: Cedrick D

customer_reviews.title: Great for small projects
customer_reviews.text: This Sandblaster works good for small projects. I wouldn't recommend it for large projects because the hopper is small. It doesn't take long at all for it to empty out. So if you have a large project then you would be refilling it a lot. I used black beauty to sandblast an antique bell. I feel it turned out very well. I have included before and after pictures of the bell. Its now ready to be painted. I would definitely recommend this sandblaster for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Decent unit for money; small capacity limits usefulness -- as expected
customer_reviews.text: Decent unit for the money and what it is. I already have a large blasting cabinet for most parts and a portable pressure-fed blaster that work well for 99% of my needs, but this handheld, gravity-fed unit is really handy for small jobs for which I don't want to deal with the larger equipment. Doesn't hold much and the media goes through quickly, so don't plan on blasting a full car frame, but for small jobs it's pretty handy. With proper expectations, this could be a handy tool for those who just need to do a few small parts.
customer_reviews.author: Brent R.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive compared to harbor freight Does not do much on rust or paint remove Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Lazar

customer_reviews.title: A good one!
customer_reviews.text: My uncle asked me if I could order a sandblaster for a small project that his friend requested of him. He isn't very good with online shopping and he also sadly didn't have much free time the past two weeks to personally look for a sandblaster gun due to work. Honestly, I don't know much about sandblasters, but this seemed like a good one. My uncle finished his project in two days. He told me that this is more convenient to use than the trash that he had before.
customer_reviews.author: Arla

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Supprised
customer_reviews.text: I just barely received my Sand Blast, and have used the blaster for a very short time. This is my first blasting job and I am very pleased. The blaster is very easy and simple to use. It removes all of the loose rust and paint making it suitable for repainting. I previously used a scaler. The sandy blaster does a better job of cleaning the rust and paint than the scaler and is much easier to use. I highly recommend the sand Blaster for removing the paint and rust scale.
customer_reviews.author: mickey

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darn good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Well first they don't supply the Air Compressor Q/D fitting so be prepared. The tool worked great though except for one problem, at least for me. You can't point the tip down because the media falls out of the nozzle. if you can hold the nozzle horizontal it works great just not vertical. This kind of messed up my plans of what I was going to use it for. When held vertical it worked great. I put the aluminum oxide media in it and it cut through rust and paint like butter. Now I just need to figure out how to work around the problem. If your just a hobbiest this is a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd Hannaford

customer_reviews.title: Low cost and easy to use sand blaster
customer_reviews.text: Low cost and easy to use sand blaster is perfect for any hobbiest. I needed to use it to clean my intake manifold on a mini cooper but will also be using it to clean the old paint of the rims of my car (the were painted when I got it). If using play sand from the store, be sure to dry it out first, possibly bake it if you're low on time. The eye protection was included with my purchase which was nice. I would recommend using a respirator with it. Also, if you're using this with 1/4 inch quick connect, you'll need your own connection.
customer_reviews.author: Programs413

customer_reviews.title: Great sandblasted for the money! Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: Great sandblaster! It came very well packaged with everything you could want and more! Easy set up and sand fill. Really works great to get down to bare minimum finishes to start over on your painting projects! It’s a great piece of equipment and a great bang for your buck! Wonderful quality and precision work! Will be back for more in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy D

customer_reviews.title: light weight and works good
customer_reviews.text: We got this to clean some iron weights so we could repaint them. It is a DYI level unit and the price reflects that. It is light, and easy to maneuver. It's mostly plastic but that makes it light and the most vital parts are steel. Nice how it attaches to an air compressor but if you need more power that that this may not work but it allows more flexible usage and good for small jobs. It does run out of media pretty quick with the small size and this unit does not come with a hose.
customer_reviews.author: AdamSch

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I immediately threw my wired and heavy old sandblaster away. This is so much better! It doesn't make my hand numb and tired since I need to work and use blasters for long hours. I am now more effective and efficient due to its portability. A lightweight and wireless sandblaster is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jbrok

customer_reviews.title: Works Flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: Gun is well made, with heavy duty plastic and metal parts. It couples very well with my air compressor and has easy on off switch, also the regulator knob is easy. It’s very efficient. Easy to know how much power I need. I used a plastic media on my fiberglass golf cart. It was very effective and sprayed perfectly without much dust or clean up. I bought this to blast my golf cart because I am going to be re-painting it. It’s has done a perfect job.
customer_reviews.author: B. Norman

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I have hesitations about the plastic holding up over time, but I think this is a pretty good unit for occasional use, especially given the price tag. It is nice that it can be used without a blasting cab - the hopper has an OK capacity, though for bigger jobs you'll want something with a better capacity. This is ideal for smaller projects.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time, money, and media
customer_reviews.text: I spent $5 at harbor freight and built a better sandblaster than this using a gatorade bottle for a hopper. The down side to the one I purchased is that it wears out way too quick. However, in the amount of time I used my $5 blaster, I could accomplish 10x the blasting that this product does. I've been trying to use it to strip paint off a mailbox. I've used twice as much media to do almost no work. This thing is great for spreading your blasting media all over the place. Crap for actually sand blasting. I'm using 80 grit glass bead, the same material I used in the home made version.
customer_reviews.author: James Kee

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: I use this to sandblast the faces of my wedges (golf) - The product is very easy to use but it did not come with everything you need to hook it up to an air compressor. That is not a knock on the product / just a heads up to buy some of the other stuff suggested by Amazon and maybe a fitting kit for air hoses / accessories. I got one from a local home improvement store and I had everything I needed. Great for smallish sandblasting jobs.
customer_reviews.author: DAP

customer_reviews.text: Unit seems to be well built. Its possible that it does not work very well because I am trying to run it off a 6 gallon pancake compressor? it woks decent in short spurts and then dosent work at all. clogs easily. might work much better with a 30 gallon compressor?
customer_reviews.author: Nick Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's just because of what I needed to do but this thing didn't work for me at all. I was trying to sand blast peeling paint off of my porch railings but it did not work for this at all...I ended up hand sanding, ugh!
customer_reviews.author: kby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent option for average home user
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for delicate and smaller to medium jobs, I used for cleaning my rusted lawnmower and it was simple, fast and straight forward. I did have to buy a 1/4 adapter because the one included did not fit my line. Capacity is good and easy to refill.
customer_reviews.author: Rody A

customer_reviews.title: I use this daily!
customer_reviews.text: For sandblasting small areas this is a wonderful sandblaster, as a welder/heavy equipment mechanic I really do use this daily. Using 40-60 copper slag as blast media. If you need to do small detailed projects it works good, if you want to blast an entire truck, you are going to have a bad time. Only issue is media consumption is somewhat high, and there are intermittent feeding issues if the gun is pointed up, but down there’s no issues. 10/10 would purchase again. Running 90-120psi through this unit
customer_reviews.author: Dustin F.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: My man absolutely loves this! He said he is amazed by the many jobs he can use this for! He’s already used it in the paint in the nooks and crannies of his car that he couldn’t reach with the sand paper. He also used it on our trailer to remove the paint:) He loves that it is lightweight and small, but strong enough to perform tough jobs. Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: wendy

customer_reviews.title: Sandblaster Sand Blaster Review
customer_reviews.text: I just setup sandblaster and yes, is to use. It works right out the box. Just like everybody, the connector included does not fit american npt air compressor connections. I had an extra and worked great. I used aluminum oxide from Harbor Freight and did the job on corrosion on nuts I had. Definitely recommend this product for small jobs like I will be using it. Air compressor craftsman 30 gallon 150 psi on 90 psi, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: MBman

customer_reviews.title: its ok
customer_reviews.text: bought med. media, had to shift to get larger stones out. With 90PSI you refill every 45sec. I bought this to blast the inside corners on a large equipment trailer. Very tough to get the gun into position. It does the job with some frustration. But it is cheaper than a full blown set up. I can see doing small parts is what this is really for.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Innovative Cabinetry

customer_reviews.title: Easily clogs
customer_reviews.text: Although I have the proper air pressure and hooked up through a moisture filter, it clogs within 15 seconds. I have to bang on the side to release the medium (fine walnut shell) to get it working for another few seconds. There is no moisture in the medium to make it clog.
customer_reviews.author: Dogdog

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Easy to use, Great Value, Will Buy Again!
customer_reviews.text: I found this product very easy to use, the instructions were very easy to follow. It runs through sand fast enough and cuts paint real easy, I was not expecting that at all. It’s a small unit, so I assumed it would clog up and end up in the trash soon after I started my project but it lasted through my first, and on to my second and then third. I was amazed. I soon started to look for stuff I wanted to spiff up. It’s so easy. Gloves and eye protection is a must!
customer_reviews.author: paragondeb

customer_reviews.title: A great option, but only for SMALL jobs -- works well with baking soda
customer_reviews.text: This works very well for the price, but the nozzle pattern is narrow, so it only cleans a very small area at a time. Also the hopper is so small that you will find yourself having to stop and refill it almost constantly.
customer_reviews.author: P. J.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR SMALL PROJECTS!!
customer_reviews.text: I just started blasting items using soda. Bought a 50lb bag and stayed having fun!! I set my pressure at around 100 psi and it works as it should. Don’t forget to install and inline water filter, as it helps stop clogging. The hopper only holds so much media, so be prepared to stop and refill. But again, small projects is what this is made for.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work, leaked air and just drained my air tank. Missed the return window by a day, so I’m out $50. I wouldn’t recommend this item to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: SniperSteve

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: Used this a few times already and I like the fact that it's easy to use does a fantastic job, and you don't always have to or want to use and suit up to use the big sandblasted. This tool is well made and is easy to use. gives you the ability to get into small ,hard to reach places on parts for cleaning. the price is right even for the abrasives used
customer_reviews.author: Batwoman

customer_reviews.title: Great starter gun!
customer_reviews.text: This little sand blaster is great. It's perfect if you just have a small job that you want to do and don't want to invest ton of time and money in cleanup and materials. It's also a perfect option for those who have never use the sand blaster before and want to try it out. Of course, it makes quite a mess so I recommend that you do it outside.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for Price. Functions as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I'm basing my review on a value for money basis. First, I used fine coal slag for my initial project of removing rust from a metal framed kitchen table with 25+ sections of stone cutouts. I ran about 30+ reservoir fills. No clogs, functioned well,, and performed it's purpose. I recommend it for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Harris

customer_reviews.title: It works but limited.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think it would work at first but it did. I have used both sand and aluminum Oxy media. The down to this is that the media is lost and not captured like it would in a cabinet type. Small pieces are OK longer can run out of media. This can be costly. I've used it several times and at 100 psi works.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: Quality product did not clog
customer_reviews.text: I’m hoping to get some good use out of this product. I used very fine abrasive blast media in the hopper. It is a small hopper but it worked for what I was doing it was nice to be portable. It also came with safety glasses which was nice. It was so easy to use and it seems to be a high quality product so it should last if properly taken care of. I did also order the in-line filter when I purchased this sandblasting gun. Everything worked perfectly. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Piontek

customer_reviews.title: Dont Buy This
customer_reviews.text: This thing barely knocks the paint off a beer can. I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: CBrackett

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good little blaster for the price. I do light automotive detailing, and needed something simple to help with paint and rust removal that would get the job done quickly, I think this will do the trick. I haven't had a chance to try it yet, but it seems to be of good quality. Now I just need to buy some sand and get shooting!
customer_reviews.author: Keslin K.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Waste Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Not a good product. Sand blasts back into your face so it’s impossible to use. Had to get close for it to work and when I did I couldn’t see even through safety goggles. Not impressed
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Cant use sand?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it stated that you could use sand and is called a sand blaster but then the 1st thing in instructions is that you cannot use sand????
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great for DIY restorations
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this sand blaster for about a month now and have to say that it's been fantastic. I have done restorations on my entire backyard deck and it's been fantastic. The trigger arm is expectational large which makes it really easy to use and grip as well. Highly recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Neel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sandblasting Gun
customer_reviews.text: Once unboxed I found that this tool was very simplistic. It is compact and easy to use. Very well made. Works as advertised. Used bicarbonate to remove finish and stain from a decorative piece on a table. This is great for the money spent. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Roy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Works good for small projects
customer_reviews.text: This product is nice, for small projects. You are not going to sandblast an entire trailer with this thing. But I am in the process of redoing the winch and mount for my boat trailer. Works pretty good. Seems to clog up a bit but could be the water seperator I am using.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This ended up being just what I was looking for! It's lightweight yet constructed nicely. It's been perfect for jobs around the house and my husband uses it in his workshop as well. It's powerful enough to handle everything I've needed done and super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia B

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This Sandblaster works very well. I've used it to remove surface rust from my trucks wheel arch and it worked great. My compressor was set to 90 psi and it was able to keep up. The blaster also did a great job polishing up some older tools I have using glass bead. All in all, it is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I am happy that I find this sandblaster.
customer_reviews.text: I am happy that I find this sandblaster. Now this guy helps me a lot around the house. The most of the boring but necessary works, such as grill cleaning, rust and layers of old paint removing, now can be done easily and quickly. Highly recommend for anyone who values his time.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey

customer_reviews.title: A joy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had a few items that I needed to sandblast. The soda blaster worked. You must use clean sand. When using the baking soda, I suggest that it be done outside or in a closed off tent. The baking soda works great but gets everywhere after it flies off of the project.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Soda/Sand Blaster
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a soda/sandblaster for a very long time. I did my research and decided this was the best choice. It is a great machine. Lightweight but solid. Economically priced. Works well. What more could you want. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle D

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value for the money. We were in need of an easy to use media blaster. We have only used it for smaller applications, bicycles, wagons, pedal cars, etc, but it would probably work just as well if you wanted to do a whole car. It seems well built, so will hopefully hold up a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This sandblaster is currently helping me repaint my back bumper on my truck. It’s a little rusted and scratched. I think this sandblaster is really easy to use. I wish the hopper was a little bit bigger but otherwise I have no complaints. Can use with a lot of different mediums.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth The $$ For Small Projects
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with this inexpensive little gun for small blasting projects. Haven’t used all the mediums it will accept but has done good with sand that I used. It goes through sand fairly quickly but works great on smaller projects!
customer_reviews.author: TechMechanic

customer_reviews.title: Great for Small Projects
customer_reviews.text: Bought to clean rust on hand tools. First use was a hand plane restoration. Using soda which worked well but may need something a little more aggressive next time. No problems, worked as advertised. Wouldn’t want to use it on large projects, but seems great for small work.
customer_reviews.author: jlwpartners

customer_reviews.title: Plastic tool that clogs
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on this product. It clogs up very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: For $50, this little thing packs a punch. While it's designed for smaller jobs, the only limit is to how many times you want to refill it. no leaks out of the box. The adapter it came with (quick connect). is NOT 1/4" NPT quick connect fittings so just keep that in mind if you will need one.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: recommend for small projects
customer_reviews.text: It's like an instant paint and rust remover, just point and squeeze the trigger. I use it with a compressor rated with a lower cfm rating than this media blaster lists as a requirement and it still performs well. My compressor typically has to kick on when the hopper runs out of blasting material. Highly recommend for small projects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sandblaster at a great price point!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent sandblaster gun for an excellent price point. It's easy to use, high quality, and absolutely does the job right. Great option for those looking for a quality sandblaster without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: David Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. Really good at cleaning smaller areas. My husband and I were redoing our garage which also included us moving a door and this product was very helpful in the cleanup. Very easy to use and very easy to store. I would definitely recommend this product. A product like this is generally much more expensive. Great value for home projects.
customer_reviews.author: Chanel Grant

customer_reviews.title: Good tool at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a sandblaster at a good price. This one works great and got the job done easily and quickly. Was easy to use and easy to clean up. I am very happy with how well it sandblasted.
customer_reviews.author: Newport 3840

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Hooked up to my compressor and blasted some rust off this piece of metal. You have to hold it pretty level for it to work consistently. Got it to take some rust spots off my car before painting. Comes with a chart talking about what to use different media for. Overall a good buy
customer_reviews.author: screen name here

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting the job done
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent blast for small projects, and has a feed rate that can accommodate large ones too. It has a built in filter which lets you sift the input media, allowing you to use more conservative things like baking soda or actual sand.
customer_reviews.author: Tomalaya

customer_reviews.title: It does do the job.
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad, I mean it does what is says. I've only used it for things i could get a grinder or wire wheel on. I got glass beads and wore a resporater and enclosed goggles.
customer_reviews.author: 1Greenmonster

customer_reviews.title: Lite Weight, small but handy Sand Blaster
customer_reviews.text: I initially purchased this to do some light body work on my truck, it worked amazingly well. Now I use it on anything that gets rusty or needs paint to be removed. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Kemmerer

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: works great. we even used strained sand (against the rules) and it worked great. But the ricochet hurts hands as they said you must wear gloves and eye protection.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great for small projects
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product... But please know this is for REALLY small projects. You can use it or any project it just gets annoying having to fill the sand every couple minutes.
customer_reviews.author: L. S.

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: Loving my sandblaster sand gun. I have never used one before, and I’m glad I purchased one. This sandblaster gun takes anything off surfaces. My BBQ has never looked so good. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.text: Freaking great ergonomics for this particular sandblaster. I can't believe I didn't get tired after finishing my project in one go. I used two media and this sandblaster performed beyond my expectations on both.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Handy, portable media blaster.
customer_reviews.text: This little media blaster is really great for small projects like cleaning the paint off my valve covers. I’ve only used crushed walnuts so far, but it did the trick. I’ve also used it to clean the rust off my wife’s lawn decorations, and it’s super fast and easy. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sean McGrew

customer_reviews.title: Great Blaster for Small Jobs
customer_reviews.text: Used this blaster to remove rust from automotive seat frames and other small parts. Works great with the fine sized material I purchased at Tractor Supply. The only drawback is that it goes through the material fast so you have to refill it often. Keep the material close by and and a large plastic cup so you can refill it quickly. I changed the air line connector to the more common industrial type since all of my other air tools use that one.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg L Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I got this tool to clean out rust from my old tools and antique equipment instead of throwing them away and buying new ones. So far it's promising and seems like it will continue to be. works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Q

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The sander works great just takes a few trys to get the amount of sand to use in the valve to be open. you also might want to wear full coverage suit to not have sand all over you and in your hair.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Good Value and Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: This product seems to be very high quality at such a great price. It's light enough and the instructions are clear enough that even a novice would feel comfortable using it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim and Donna Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: This little thing runs thru media QUICK! I had to fill it twice per wheel/ per side (4 fill ups per wheel) the spray pattern is very wide and to be honest is kinda hard to used in tight areas because you can’t pinpoint the pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Kersh

customer_reviews.title: I'm a novice and I can make it work!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used anything like this in the past, but because it is small and lightweight, it was something I was able to use on my own. I used it to clean up some old wood that had been outside for a lot of years, so I could use it in craft projects. Although I wasn't using it on anything intricate, I think it would be especially handy for something like that. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Craft

customer_reviews.title: Great little sandblaster!
customer_reviews.text: Got this sandblaster for up-dos around the farm and was a leery about one with such a low cost. Its so small but dang sturdy. Husband does a lot of welding and building so, this is great for him. Instructions are clear and concise easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Shannon

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on small DIY projects. I've de-rusted my old tools with this. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Moonlight

customer_reviews.title: Do not consider for big projects. More like a toy rather than a tool:(
customer_reviews.text: This product was more like a toy than a tool the soda blasted within seconds and had to be refilled. Not good for a big project maybe something small like a frame.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy lou

customer_reviews.title: Small yet very very effective.
customer_reviews.text: Simple but it very effective. Great media blaster for small projects. It's great for small DIY projects. This is definitely lightweight and easy to use. Allowed me to quickly de-rust my tools.
customer_reviews.author: Bhaven P.

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to remove paint from a picket fence. It does not remove paint. I used the material they recommend. This thing is a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Maicol

customer_reviews.title: Great and simple
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product that came with eye wear for protection...inexpensive choice if you have a compressor. Was a little tedious having to refill the media but great price point for sporadic small projects.
customer_reviews.author: Stands

customer_reviews.title: No complaints!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this specifically to strip some paint from the motorcycle that I am working on and it worked great! Easy and simple to use and I see myself using it for many future projects in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Brown

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job for its intended use
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job for its intended use. However it can be a bit finicky if the media is not 100% dry. I used aluminum oxide to sand blast some rust from an old pipe. The sand felt dry to the touch but seemed to clump up in the gun. I let the media sit in the sun for a bit. I then reloaded the media in the gun and it worked flawlessly. I was surprised how little air the gun required. Nice for small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value, works well
customer_reviews.text: This tool works well. At times need shaking when it cloggs (may be poor quality media). Good for hobbyist and small projects as the tank empties pretty fast. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Francesco

customer_reviews.title: clogging with 24 grit walnut shells
customer_reviews.text: This product States that it works with walnut shells, fine grit. I tried it out with 24 grit walnut shell medium. The product kept clogging and I have to jiggle The knob that controls how much medium comes out, to get the medium to come out at all. I did not overfill it and I do have a water in oil separator. Kinda sucks 😕
customer_reviews.author: Dat Beetch

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: It's very smooth and love it using it. Use it a lot each day on a tandum trailer we bought from a neighbor that needs some TLC and this is exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle W.

customer_reviews.title: Quality, value, easy.
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box. Put thread tape on the fitting and put walnut shells in the tank. Hooked it up to my air line and sprayed. Within the time frame of opening the box and setup to spraying took ten minutes. Very easy to use. Worth the money. Woukd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Better of going to harbour freight
customer_reviews.text: Would have been cheaper to buy one at harbour freight, and actually did buy the larger unit at harbour freight to complete my job. Good for very, very small jobs or fine detail work.
customer_reviews.author: KWP

customer_reviews.title: Nice light sandblasting gun
customer_reviews.text: Super fast delivery. Blasting gun seems well made and is very light, so should be easy to use without making your arm tired. Can't wait to get to use it.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Item was delivered as desceibed.
customer_reviews.text: Best to use outside as there will be alot of particles spread out.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Great for small projects or spots
customer_reviews.text: Great little sand blaster for small projects or spot blasting. I used fine sand and worked great.
customer_reviews.author: RTH

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid and affordable unit that accepts different media types. If you aren’t sandblasting all the time then this is what you want. Just leave the sand in your backyard. Almost zero cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Burnworth

customer_reviews.title: Clean cummins frame surface rust/corrosion
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t find a decent sand blaster for out door use and touch ups. I used it to blast my truck clean. Use pool filtered sand, rain coat, face shield, and a respirator.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on small jobs around the house. Works great for that, much better than I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: HollowMan

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect for my application
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gun kit to sandblast my motorcycle cylinder and cylinder heads with light media to make them look like new. It worked great and will be able to use this for other project.
customer_reviews.author: Uwe Meffle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for rust removal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product after a Harbol Freight blaster failed, this one was so much better I didn't have any of the problems with this one that I had with the Harbor Freight Junk. I would recommend every shop have one just for small jobs where you don't want to pull out the big blasters
customer_reviews.author: W. J. Slater

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: I haven't yet tried this product, but it is defined in the description. I will update this review as soon as I try it.
customer_reviews.author: Aken Bosch

customer_reviews.title: Shooting sand
customer_reviews.text: It was a little bulky and hurts your wrist with long use. Seemed top heavy if the bin is completely full. Would have liked smaller nozzle option. Goes through sand very quickly. Constantly filling it up. Overall a good product.
customer_reviews.author: myclan04

customer_reviews.title: Great on small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Great light weight for small jobs. Needs a larger hopper, some work on the trigger but for small jobs it does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: LE LEMATEC AS118 Sand Blaster Gun Kit For Use with Air Compressors. Compatible with All Media Types.
feature_bullets: LE LEMATEC SANDBLASTER IS EASY TO USE AND SETUP, kit comes with 1/4'' NPT quick connector, user manual, & media guide so you can start sand blasting right out of the box.
WITH THE PORTABLE SANDBLASTER YOUR APPLICATIONS ARE ENDLESS, almost all media types are compatible such as soda, walnut shell, and aluminum oxide. Great for DIY or professional projects.
SANDBLASTING WITH THE GRAVITY FEED SANDBLASTER makes sandblasting most convenient without being tethered to a siphon hose. Blast in tight spaces or hard to reach areas.
USES ARE ENDLESS such as glass etching, paint prep, furniture restoration and pool tile cleanup.
FOR OPTIMUM RESULTS WE RECOMMEND an air compressor that can maintain over 90 PSI with a minimum cfm of 4.0 at 150 psi. An air compressor inline air filter is also recommend.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars703 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
